Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers, 'Ells Bells and Acorn Antiques....”
Reviews.Author: MHNH2010
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness - how a website can deceive!! This is NO WAY a four star establishment. We stopped here for 3 nights as part of a group tour and the sentiment I'm about to express was shared by all 36 members of the party. The place is nothing but a facade. It looks like it has undergone considerable upgrading recently - ultra-swish and modern reception area complete with piano, and rooms which are eye-wateringly contemporary yet sadly lacking in anything remotely practical. There was nowhere to put clothes - no drawers, no wardrobe, only 4 coathangers for 2 people. The air-con was incomprehensible and didn't work. The achingly modern bathroom looked impressive but the overhead 'rain' shower unfortunately didn't rain, but rather piddled, and you had to run round under it to get wet. It was clean, though. The money spent on the renovations however, must have run out by the time it got to the staff. They were indifferent to the point of being rude and ignorant. Mealtimes were nothing but a joke. The food itself was barely edible. The breakfast consisted of the previous evening's stale rolls, plastic cheese, dodgy ham, questionable juice (powder and water?) and machine-generated tea and coffee. Our substandard evening meals were brought to our tables on metal trollies - giving the impression we were in some sort of work canteen. Plates were thrust at the table by a miserable woman in jeans who looked liked she had been dragged in off the street to help out against her will. The mystery continued outside - what looked like was once a considerably-sized pool, was just a sea of green turf with an odd tiled platform poking out which may have housed a diving board in a previous life. The one redeeming feature of the hotel was its proximity to Venice Mestre train station, which was very handy. It would be ok for an overnight stopover for a businessman/woman with minimal luggage but for anyone considering it as holiday accommodation, look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant staff, no room service! How is it 4* hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Dulcinea_del_Tob0s0
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel looks really nice at reception and our room was reasonable, we soon found out the 'behind the scenes' in this hotel. They have clearly spent a great deal of money making it look nice, and providing some interesting technology with way in which room doors are opened. Upon arrival, however, they did not greet us (not even a 'hello!) or say welcome, they asked for our passports and gave us our room card, but did not explain hwo it works, assuming we are meant to understand that we must flash the card in front of a panel on the wall next to the door? I do not regard myself as technologically backwards, but I was both impressed at the innovation and unimpressed at their failing to tell us the smallest detail. We could not work out how the controls for the air conditioning/heating were set, as it was -4C outside and the air was coming out cold. When we asked at reception the response was 'it IS winter, sir'... And that's why I have to be cold? because it's winter? The first night we were very tired and decided to have room service, only to be told that there was not any, and we had to come downstairs to have a coffee... from a machine!! in ITALY!! c'mon! The breakfast... best not to get into details... consisted of boiled eggs, some questionable bits of meat, and cheese slices in their plastic laid out on trays, plus the abovementioned coffee from a machine. I have since then reported we left a pair of trousers in the room, which we know we did, as we realised upon exit but didn't have time to collect due to our plane leaving. After 2 attempts finally they confirmed they had them, and asked me for my address details. That was 2 weeks ago. I have since written to them 3 times asking them for confirmation and they have not responded, so I am treating this as theft, and I have let them know as much... Still no answer... begs the questions, why a 4* hotel?!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Jensen63
Reviews.Content: Close to bus/train to Venice and reasonable prices. We stayed in the old part. Rooms fine and clean. The promised swimmingpool and garden do not exist and some of the staff at front desk were unhelpful. Restaurant was poor including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Ali R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Lugano Torretta and thought it was an excellent hotel, Firstly, upon arriving the hotel staff were so friendly and spoke in english aswell as italian and spanish. Upon entering the room, was so clean with brand new bedsheets which were changed daily. New towels given everyday. Room had AC which could be kept on all day/night which was great due to the heat (34 degrees). There was a small mini fridge which kept the food fresh (tv in italian) but was ok as i understand. Water in the shower stayed constantly hot unlike many other places i have stayed. Breakfast was also included (not amazing but no where near bad) had a lot of variety even if you are vegetarian and was actually tasty,especially the croissants. The bus link was excellent, bascially outside the hotel door, and straight into venice centre foe less than 1.50 ! The same for the journey back, it dropped you outside the hotel door. This was very important to me the bus link, buses ran till midnight and then also a night time bus. If you travel to venice marco polo best to get the (ALTO) bus which is 5euros one way, to venice mestre train station, turn left, and walk to train station, which is 2 min walk, from there go under into the station, down some steps and walk on, and when you walk out the other side of the train tunnel, there is the hotel basically in front of you. no need to take taxi to the hotel as you can walk there within 5 minutes. The same way to go back to the airport. Downside, swimming pool was not working , had work done to it which was not said and the toilet is beautifully modern but there is a small strip on the window to protet the toilet which means people can see you in the room. but thats the only downside. If you would like to know more email me at balal29@hotmail.com ALL IN ALL .... for ME .... Great hotel, ... modern , clean and comfortable !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing in Venice”
Reviews.Author: joani1806
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and modern and very easy to travel from it to Venice by bus. It is about a 10 minute bus ride and this is the best way to go into Venice. Our first night we drove to Venice and it cost us 24 Euros to get our car out of the parking garage. Rooms are clean and the beds were good. There is wifi in the rooms. Breakfast was only adequate--there were hot eggs and some type of meat but they did not look appetizing. We found some of the front desk staff to be impatient and somewhat rude as if we were bothering them. They must remember that we are travelling and if we ask directions (more than once) it is because they responded so quickly that we weren't sure we understood just where we were to go and wanted to be sure we could find our way

Reviews.Title: “very clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: dido50
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel ,we found it to be a great base for visiting venice,a short walk to the bus or train station then a 15min journey,suited us fine,public transport very good value for money as well. The hotel itself was very clean and modern ,my only complaint was the glass wall in bedroom which revealed the shower and toilet not too bad if you are alone but even couples need a bit of privacy when at the toilet,I expressed my dislike to hotel receptionist I think he thought it was strange not to like it but listened to what I said and next day gave us another room as he had not got a suitable one left that day ,It was a beautiful room but we found that strange maybe others would not think the same,maybe it is because we have nothing like that in England. The breakfast was very nice and you could eat as much or as little as you wanted . If we ever visit this area again we would certainly think about going back to this hotel,we paid a very good price and had very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is not a 4 star and there is nothing to do in the vicinity”
Reviews.Author: 1knowing1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel following a cruise in March of 2011. The picture on travelocity.com looked OK and I trusted them instead of doing a complete research. Everyone know Venice to be a city of Romance etc. This hotel location was the pits. I must say that it was clean. While the shower was a bit small, the bathroom was OK. The room was drab and the scenery worse. This is really a 21/2 rating. however as a result of them having internet access; I will give them a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , super clean, easy to get to the heart of Venice...”
Reviews.Author: fossilmatron
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night her awaiting a cruise. This hotel is currently undergoing building work , but as we were there on a Sunday it did not affect us. It is very close to the Venice Mestre train station which is a short 10-15 minute train ride to St Lucia Venice station , and costs 1 euro each way.When you get off at Mestre, head for the Marghera side.The continental breakfast was comprehensive. There is WiFi access available for a charge. The bedroom looked exactly like the photos on the website. Most evenings the restaurant has a set meal for 15 euros. We can recommend the restaurant a few hundered metres down the road just the other side of the roundabout, the Restaurant/Pizzeria Capri

Reviews.Title: “NEAR TRAIN STATION”
Reviews.Author: delWirral
Reviews.Content: The room was ok but the staff were very indifferent and not at all helpful.We booked with Cosmos and thought the Hotel would have been good. I'm a veggie and my evening meal consisted cold soup, salad ie lettuce, half a tomato, two lumps of cheese and sliced carrot in rings. We wanted to use the pool but it was really dirty. We wouldn't go back .

Reviews.Title: “Is a 4 Star Hotel but 7 are missing....!!!!! Is a big mistake to go there..!!!”
Reviews.Author: lcarralero
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with the Tour operator Iberojet (You must runaway when you see this name) in a tour.The room is about 1.5 x 1.5 meter, you just have space for get into the room one person at the time and if you go to the bathroom, if you are over 130 pounds be ready to get stuck in the shower (if you can call it in that way).Motel 6 and Motel * are five stars hotel beside this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Expect additional costs”
Reviews.Author: tedtug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within a tree lined street in one of Venice's suburbs, but it's not within the lagoon. It's a typical Italian hotel, small rooms, tiny bathrooms, humdrum breakfast. The worse thing about this hotel however, is that if you want to use it's pool, you have to pay an additional 10 Euro per person, even though you're staying at the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “You must be joking!”
Reviews.Author: Homespunner
Reviews.Content: I just looked at the photos on tripadvisor and had to laugh. So, we were in southern Austria and decided due to lack of snow to head to Venice for two days. We went to the Mestre train station and booked the Luton hotel based on price and rating (four stars? - please!!). We were two families, each with two kids in the 10-12 range. They said the rooms would be tight if we had the kids in the room and sheesh were they right. The beds, all four, were tiny singles unfit for a 6' 2" adult like me. They are under renovation but put us far from the construction which was a plus. The lobby is clean but unbelievably tacky. One of the buildings in the photos is no longer there, thus my amusement. The staff was multi-lingual and helpful and the breakfast staff was top-notch, though the food was just "good". It is a short walk to the train station for the one Euro ride to Venice, so it has the efficiency aspect going for it. Before you choose this option, ask about the construction!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine!”
Reviews.Author: soph_jay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2006 as part of a Cosmos touring holiday, and thought the hotel to be asolutely fine! The rooms were clean and modern, although the air conditioning was not particularly great! As regards location, although the hotel is a long way out of Venice centre, and there is not much in the area of the hotel, the train station is very close to the hotel, and it is only one stop to the centre of Venice. So, as long as you are prepared to use the public transport, the location of the hotel is not a problem! All in all, the breakfasts were fine, the rooms were clean, and the staff polite, I can't find anything to complain about! Although I wouldn't find the hotel deserving of 4star status in terms of British or American ratings, it is perfectly adequate, and more likely to be a 3 and a half star!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this for 2 nights hotel as part of Cosmos touring holiday. The airconditioning did not work at any time despite promises from the staff. The room safe did not work despite promises to the contrary so we tried to use a facility at reception where they suggested we tie our valuables in a plastic bag we declined and had to carry them around for 2 days. The shower worked but resulted in flooding the bathroom floor which had to be dried before we could use it again. The location was convenient with the railway station only 200 yards away. This is certainly not a 4star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: glassofred
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with COSMOS - never again! ïƒ˜filthy with a layer of dust on the dining room furniture enough to leave my autograph. Place hasn't been redecorated since 1970! ïƒ˜2â€™6â€� beds and hardly 15 inches to get past the beds, stains on the 'sofa' ïƒ˜on the last morning we had no running water from the bathroom taps and had to use the shower to brush our teeth ïƒ˜view from our window â€“ a scrap yard ïƒ˜pool â€“ no water although air temperature was around 25C ïƒ˜included dinner â€“ I ate better at university! Food was slapped onto our plates with no idea what type of meat it was and since when were chips an Italian delicacy? ïƒ˜Getting into Venice was not that difficult as train station was very near by but save your money and find a proper 4 Star hotel - this one deserves to loose it's stars and COSMOS should know better than to offer such a dive!air conditioning â€“ blew lovely warm air

Reviews.Title: “Cosmos Trip 2004”
Reviews.Author: Retiredandhappy48
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Cosmos 2004 trip to Venice, Rome and Florence, stayed 2 nights at Lugano Torretta. Agree that rooms are small,ours had 2 x 2'6" beds but was clean, and bathroom with shower only was fine. Both breakfasts were perfectly adequate and staff helpful. The one evening meal was pasta followed by pork,veg and chips and fruit salad better than expected having read previous review. If you stayed nearer to Venice, then price would be much higher, so all in all thought it was O.K.

HotelInfo.Name: Lugano Torretta
HotelInfo.Address: Via Rizzardi 11, 30175 Venice, Italy
